Package LibrarySystem

Class LoanableItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • LibrarySystem.LoanableItem
  • class LoanableItem
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the parent class for all loanable items in the library system. Shared properties and methods used by these iterms are defined in this class.
    Setters are used to set the properties for each object. These are called in each objects contructor, as defined in the child classes.
    All fields are created private and then changed/set for each object with the relevant setter.
    The protected access modifier is used for setters as to not expose them to anything other than the child classes. Modifying of objects is not defined in the assignment scope.
    The GetObjectType method is private as this is not needed outside of the parent class.
    Version:
    1.0

      • GetLoanStatus

        public java.lang.String GetLoanStatus()
        Retrieves the loan status of the current object, which is set by the SetLoanStatus method in each objects constructor.
        Returns:
        The item loan status (eg "Yes")

      • GenerateReport

        public java.lang.String GenerateReport()
        The reportDetails field is generated by invoking the specified methods and returning them into the string. The exact format of the reportDetails field is determined by invoking the GetLoanStatus method and checking whether or not the current object is on loan.
        Returns:
        The object report format (reportDetails). A return date is appended to the end of the string if the item is on loan, by invoking the comparing the loanStatus of the object in iteration and adding the return value to the string.
